description: A land developer uploads a land‑use agreement PDF and the ClauseClear assistant extracts the text, parses key clauses, generates plain‑language summaries for zoning restrictions, development milestones, and penalty provisions, flags risky language, and provides a downloadable markdown briefing.

messages.content: You are ClauseClear, an AI‑powered legal contract summarizer. You can upload PDFs, extract their text, parse standard clauses, generate plain‑language summaries, flag risky language, and export a briefing in markdown or PDF. Answer the user in a clear, friendly tone and always show the results of any tool you invoke.

Hi, I have a land‑use agreement I need to review. Could you give me plain‑language summaries of the zoning restrictions, the development milestones, and flag any penalty provisions? I’ve attached the file.

File name: land_use_agreement.pdf
Base64 content: JVBERi0xLjQKc3RhZ... (truncated for brevity)
Sure, I’ll upload the PDF you provided, extract the text, and then analyse the relevant clauses.
PDF uploaded successfully. I’ll now extract the searchable text from the document.

{"contract_text": "Section 5 – Zoning Restrictions: The Developer shall comply with the municipal zoning code, which limits the total buildable area to 10,000 sq ft, prohibits residential use, and requires a minimum setback of 20 ft from the property line.

Section 8 – Development Milestones: Phase 1 must be completed within 12 months of the Effective Date, including site grading and utility installation. Phase 2, construction of the commercial building, shall be finished within 24 months thereafter.

Section 12 – Penalty Provisions: If any milestone is not met, the Developer shall pay liquidated damages of $5,000 per month of delay, not to exceed $200,000. Additionally, the Municipality may terminate the Agreement upon a material breach.

Section 3 – Confidentiality: Both parties agree to keep confidential all non‑public information.

Section 15 – Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of Example."}
Text extracted. I’ll parse the contract to identify the standard clauses.

arguments.contract_text:
Section 5 – Zoning Restrictions: The Developer shall comply with the municipal zoning code, which limits the total buildable area to 10,000 sq ft, prohibits residential use, and requires a minimum setback of 20 ft from the property line.

Section 8 – Development Milestones: Phase 1 must be completed within 12 months of the Effective Date, including site grading and utility installation. Phase 2, construction of the commercial building, shall be finished within 24 months thereafter.

Section 12 – Penalty Provisions: If any milestone is not met, the Developer shall pay liquidated damages of $5,000 per month of delay, not to exceed $200,000. Additionally, the Municipality may terminate the Agreement upon a material breach.

Section 3 – Confidentiality: Both parties agree to keep confidential all non‑public information.

Section 15 – Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of Example.

Phase 2, construction of the commercial building, shall be finished within 24 months thereafter."}, {"type": "penalty", "text": "Section 12 – Penalty Provisions: If any milestone is not met, the Developer shall pay liquidated damages of $5,000 per month of delay, not to exceed $200,000. Additionally, the Municipality may terminate the Agreement upon a material breach."}, {"type": "confidentiality", "text": "Section 3 – Confidentiality: Both parties agree to keep confidential all non‑public information."}, {"type": "governing_law", "text": "Section 15 – Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of Example."}]}
I’ll now create plain‑language summaries for the three clauses you’re interested in.

arguments.clause_text: Section 5 – Zoning Restrictions: The Developer shall comply with the municipal zoning code, which limits the total buildable area to 10,000 sq ft, prohibits residential use, and requires a minimum setback of 20 ft from the property line.

Section 8 – Development Milestones: Phase 1 must be completed within 12 months of the Effective Date, including site grading and utility installation. Phase 2, construction of the commercial building, shall be finished within 24 months thereafter.

Section 12 – Penalty Provisions: If any milestone is not met, the Developer shall pay liquidated damages of $5,000 per month of delay, not to exceed $200,000. Additionally, the Municipality may terminate the Agreement upon a material breach.

messages.content: {"summary_text": "The project must follow local zoning rules: you can build up to 10,000 sq ft, you cannot use the land for residential purposes, and you must keep at least a 20‑foot distance from the property boundary."}

{"summary_text": "Two development phases are required. Phase 1 (site grading and utility hookup) must be finished within one year of the contract start date. Phase 2 (building the commercial structure) must be completed within the following two years."}
{"summary_text": "If any milestone is missed, you owe $5,000 for each month of delay, up to a maximum of $200,000. The municipality can also end the agreement if there is a serious breach."}
Summaries are ready. I’ll now evaluate the clauses for risky or non‑standard language.

clauses.text: Section 5 – Zoning Restrictions: The Developer shall comply with the municipal zoning code, which limits the total buildable area to 10,000 sq ft, prohibits residential use, and requires a minimum setback of 20 ft from the property line.

Section 8 – Development Milestones: Phase 1 must be completed within 12 months of the Effective Date, including site grading and utility installation. Phase 2, construction of the commercial building, shall be finished within 24 months thereafter.

Section 12 – Penalty Provisions: If any milestone is not met, the Developer shall pay liquidated damages of $5,000 per month of delay, not to exceed $200,000. Additionally, the Municipality may terminate the Agreement upon a material breach.
Section 3 – Confidentiality: Both parties agree to keep confidential all non‑public information.
Section 15 – Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of Example.

messages.content: {"risk_flags": [{"clause_type": "penalty", "risk": "High liquidated damages", "explanation": "The contract imposes $5,000 per month of delay, which can quickly become costly, and caps at $200,000, which may still be a large exposure.", "mitigation": "Negotiate a lower per‑day penalty or add grace periods for delays caused by force majeure."}, {"clause_type": "termination", "risk": "Broad termination right", "explanation": "The municipality can terminate the agreement on any material breach, which may be interpreted broadly.", "mitigation": "Define specific events that constitute a material breach and consider adding a cure period before termination is permitted."}]}
Now I’ll compile the summaries and risk flags into a downloadable briefing.

summaries.summary_text: The project must follow local zoning rules: you can build up to 10,000 sq ft, you cannot use the land for residential purposes, and you must keep at least a 20‑foot distance from the property boundary.

Two development phases are required. Phase 1 (site grading and utility hookup) must be finished within one year of the contract start date. Phase 2 (building the commercial structure) must be completed within the following two years.
If any milestone is missed, you owe $5,000 for each month of delay, up to a maximum of $200,000. The municipality can also end the agreement if there is a serious breach.

risk_flags.explanation: The contract imposes $5,000 per month of delay, which can quickly become costly, and caps at $200,000, which may still be a large exposure.
risk_flags.mitigation: Negotiate a lower per‑day penalty or add grace periods for delays caused by force majeure.

risk_flags.explanation: The municipality can terminate the agreement on any material breach, which may be interpreted broadly.
risk_flags.mitigation: Define specific events that constitute a material breach and consider adding a cure period before termination is permitted.

messages.content:
✅ All done! I’ve generated a concise briefing that includes plain‑language summaries of the zoning restrictions, development milestones, and penalty provisions, plus highlighted risk points with suggested mitigations.

You can download the markdown file here:
https://clauseclear.example.com/downloads/briefing_9f8e7d.md

Feel free to let me know if you’d like any clause expanded, have questions about the risks, or need the briefing in PDF format.
